Search results

hpf

second order high pass filter [in 0.0, freq 440.0] in - Input signal to be processed freq - Cutoff frequency A high pass filter lets through the frequencies above the cutoff point and successfully dampens the frequencies below the cutoff point. This effectively removes the fundamental frequency of the sound, leaving only the fizz harmonic overtones. High pass filters are rarely used in the creation of instruments and are predominantly used to create effervexcent sound effects of bright timbres that can be laid over the top of another low pass sound to increase the harmonic content. Categories: Rates: [ :ar, :kr ] Default rate: :auto
